description.narrative: CRD's intervention is to strengthen the capacities of local CSOs to act as agents for change, furthering a more pluralistic civil society. CRD has developed solid partnerships with the overall objective to seek accountability of office-holders, furthering citizens' demand for increased responsibility from the state. CRD supported free and independent media and it has been prioritised in the proposal through journalist's associations and alternative media channels. CRD works in increasing the respect for the human rights of vulnerable groups in Kosovo with specific focus on RAE communities hence combating discrimination. As this was phasing out period, Sida has assessed that there are no changes in relation to it previous assessment.

CRD har presenterat ett förslag som innebär ett års fortsättning av projektet ”Improving Access to Information and Equality in Kosovo 2016-2018”. Det totala stödet för perioden 2016-2018 uppgår till 14 715 000 SEK.
Efter en analys av den övergripande situationen och med tanke på omständigheterna kommer Sida att förbereda ett kompletterande beslut för 1 år med utfasning och slutförande av CRD:s bilaterala program i Kosovo.
Sida kommer att förlänga samarbetsavtalet med CRD med ett år till 30 juni 2019 med en aktivitetsperiod till 31 december 2018.
CRD has presented a proposal to continue for eight months the project "Improving Access to Information and Equality in Kosovo 2016-2018". The total amount for support for the period 2016-2018 is 14 715 000 SEK.
CRD has submitted revised budget 2016-2108 and consequence analysis. After an analysis of the overall situation and considering the circumstances allocations, Sida has prepared a supplementary decision for a phasing out and finalization of the CRD bilateral program in Kosovo adding 4.0 MSEK for 2018 covering the activity period to 31st December 2018. Sida will extend the cooperation agreement with CRD until 30 June 2019.
The following articles will be amended. Article 2 - Activity period of the Project; Article 3 – Financing of the project and provisional disbursement schedule; Article 5 - Reporting & Recovery; Article 7 – Audit; Article 12 – Termination.
Support to Civil Rights Defenders in Kosovo 2016-2018

tag.narrative: 16.b - Promote and enforce non-discriminatory laws and policies for sustainable development.
16.b - Verka för och genomdriva icke-diskriminerande lagstiftning och politik för en hållbar utveckling.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: During the reporting period Civil Rights Defenders continued to nurture long-term cooperation with its partners, focusing on different aspects of their work. In order to ensure their sustainability and improved performance, we have organized numerous capacity-building, networking and advocacy activities. All the activities have been carefully planned in direct communication and consultation with the partners, based on our mutual needs assessment and followed by the monitoring of the implementation of the acquired know-how. This approach resulted in exceedingly positive evaluations of the above-mentioned activities by partner organizations. The period of 2016 - 2018 has been a challenging year for the partners, given the trend of shrinking space for civil society in Kosovo and increased level of political influence in public sphere. Some of the partners have been affected by this switch that had also influenced donor support to human rights organizations. Our activities under the outcome Local human rights defenders are empowered contributed to the partners’ capacities to cope with such challenges and to establish stronger cooperation with other relevant actors dealing with human rights. We have contributed to strengthening the capacities of Roma human rights defenders directly encouraged members of this community to increase their visibility and demand respect for their rights.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
